events.message: The customer reported a car accident that occurred on icy roads resulting in moderate damage to the vehicle's front bumper and headlights.
The claim was categorized as an auto accident claim based on the report describing vehicle collision and damage.
An agent was assigned to handle the case to ensure proper follow-up and communication with the customer.
Acknowledgment of the auto accident claim was sent to the customer, confirming receipt and next steps.
Requested police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and repair estimates from the customer for assessment.
Customer submitted the police report, vehicle damage photographs, and three repair shop estimates.
The investigation team began reviewing submitted evidence and contacted the repair shops for validation.
Investigation concluded confirming the damages matched the accident report, and liability is consistent.
A settlement amount covering estimated repair costs and vehicle downtime compensation was proposed.
Customer responded affirmatively to the proposed settlement, expressing satisfaction with the quick resolution.
The claim was officially approved following the customer's acceptance of the settlement terms.
Payment corresponding to the settlement amount was processed and issued to the customer's account.
The auto accident claim case was officially closed after confirming receipt of payment by the customer.
The file for the claim has been archived in the system for future reference and records.
